about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: You exit the freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should:

about.name: You exit the freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should:

hasPart.assesses: You exit the freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should: | You exit the freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You should always slow down before entering a curve. You may not be able to see hazards ahead and braking in a curve may cause your vehicle to skid.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow to a safe speed before the curve.

comment.text: Slow to a safe speed before the curve.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow to the posted speed limit for the freeway.

comment.text: Slow to the posted speed limit for the freeway.

suggestedAnswer.text: Wait until you have entered the curve to begin braking.

comment.text: Wait until you have entered the curve to begin braking.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow to a safe speed before the curve.

comment.text: Slow to a safe speed before the curve.

answerExplanation.text: You should always slow down before entering a curve. You may not be able to see hazards ahead and braking in a curve may cause your vehicle to skid.

hasPart.name: When parking your vehicle on any hill:

about.name: When parking your vehicle on any hill:

hasPart.assesses: When parking your vehicle on any hill: | When parking your vehicle on any hill: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When parking on a hill, you should always leave your vehicle in gear or in the "park" position. If there is no curb, you should turn your front wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail. If there is a curb, the front wheels should be turned toward it (if headed downhill) or away from and gently touching it (if headed uphill).

suggestedAnswer.text: One of your rear wheels should touch the curb.

comment.text: One of your rear wheels should touch the curb.

suggestedAnswer.text: Use your parking brake and leave the vehicle in "park."

comment.text: Use your parking brake and leave the vehicle in "park."

suggestedAnswer.text: Your front wheels should be parallel to the road, if there is no curb.

comment.text: Your front wheels should be parallel to the road, if there is no curb.

acceptedAnswer.text: Use your parking brake and leave the vehicle in "park."

comment.text: Use your parking brake and leave the vehicle in "park."

answerExplanation.text: When parking on a hill, you should always leave your vehicle in gear or in the "park" position. If there is no curb, you should turn your front wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail. If there is a curb, the front wheels should be turned toward it (if headed downhill) or away from and gently touching it (if headed uphill).

comment.text: When parking your vehicle on any hill: | When parking on a hill, you should always leave your vehicle in gear or in the "park" position. If there is no curb, you should turn your front wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail. If there is a curb, the front wheels should be turned toward it (if headed downhill) or away from and gently touching it (if headed uphill).

about.name: You see pedestrians near the road. You should:

hasPart.assesses: You see pedestrians near the road. You should: | You see pedestrians near the road. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Watch for any pedestrian who may cross your path. If you see pedestrians near the road where you are driving, slow down and be prepared to stop, if necessary.

suggestedAnswer.text: Sound your horn and maintain your speed.

comment.text: Sound your horn and maintain your speed.

suggestedAnswer.text: Speed up to clear the area quickly.

comment.text: Speed up to clear the area quickly.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and pass with caution.

comment.text: Slow down and pass with caution.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down and pass with caution.

comment.text: Slow down and pass with caution.

hasPart.name: You must stop at the intersection ahead. Just before the intersection, you have to cross railroad tracks. You should stop before crossing the railroad tracks when:

hasPart.text: If you need to stop after crossing railroad tracks, wait until you can completely cross the tracks before proceeding. Make sure your vehicle clears the tracks before you stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.

comment.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.

suggestedAnswer.text: The crossing is located in a city or town with frequent train traffic.

comment.text: The crossing is located in a city or town with frequent train traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are transporting two or more children in a passenger vehicle.

comment.text: You are transporting two or more children in a passenger vehicle.

acceptedAnswer.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.

comment.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.

hasPart.text: When parking downhill, turn your front wheels toward the curb or edge of the road. When parking uphill on a road without a curb, turn your wheels toward the edge of the road. When parking uphill on a road with a curb, you must turn your front wheels away from the curb.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn your wheels sharply toward the side of the road.

comment.text: Turn your wheels sharply toward the side of the road.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn your wheels away from the side of the road.

comment.text: Turn your wheels away from the side of the road.
Keep your wheels straight.

acceptedAnswer.text: Turn your wheels sharply toward the side of the road.

comment.text: Turn your wheels sharply toward the side of the road.

answerExplanation.text: When parking downhill, turn your front wheels toward the curb or edge of the road. When parking uphill on a road without a curb, turn your wheels toward the edge of the road. When parking uphill on a road with a curb, you must turn your front wheels away from the curb.

comment.text: If you parallel park facing downward on a hill: | When parking downhill, turn your front wheels toward the curb or edge of the road. When parking uphill on a road without a curb, turn your wheels toward the edge of the road. When parking uphill on a road with a curb, you must turn your front wheels away from the curb.

hasPart.name: If you want to enter the freeway but you don't see a gap in traffic, you should:

about.name: If you want to enter the freeway but you don't see a gap in traffic, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If you want to enter the freeway but you don't see a gap in traffic, you should: | If you want to enter the freeway but you don't see a gap in traffic, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If you want to enter the freeway but do not see a space for your vehicle in traffic, slow down on the ramp to wait for a gap. Do not drive to the end of the ramp and wait for a gap or you will not have enough room to accelerate to the speed of traffic before entering the roadway.

suggestedAnswer.text: Maintain your speed and force the other drivers to create a gap.

comment.text: Maintain your speed and force the other drivers to create a gap.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down on the ramp to wait for a gap.

comment.text: Slow down on the ramp to wait for a gap.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop at the end of the ramp to wait for a gap.

comment.text: Stop at the end of the ramp to wait for a gap.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down on the ramp to wait for a gap.

comment.text: Slow down on the ramp to wait for a gap.

answerExplanation.text: If you want to enter the freeway but do not see a space for your vehicle in traffic, slow down on the ramp to wait for a gap. Do not drive to the end of the ramp and wait for a gap or you will not have enough room to accelerate to the speed of traffic before entering the roadway.

comment.text: If you want to enter the freeway but you don't see a gap in traffic, you should: | If you want to enter the freeway but do not see a space for your vehicle in traffic, slow down on the ramp to wait for a gap.
